record.dc:title: 11-337 C.J. Walters Farm Site 11UN11, Union County, Tennessee. Feature 13, Structure [number 4].
record.wpa:narrative: A small structure with central fireplace filled with ashes. Numerous postmolds made definition of structure indistinct. Large hole in NE corner filled with ash. Numerous molds were partially filled with mussel and gastropod shells. Many bones were found in holes. The central fireplace was filled and heaped with ash (cf. photo 11-337). When ashes were removed a large pit of irregular shape, 22 inches deep was disclosed just NW of the fireplace. The firepit was 8" deep, of nearly vertical walls and 18" in diameter (cf. photo 11-338). Within the area inclosed by dotted line on the chart, a well hardened floor was found around the fireplace. Several holes near this hardened area were 10-12 inches deep. The outer postmolds average 6-8 inches deep.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photographs 11-338 [fhm01822], 11-339 [fhm01823], and 11-340 [fhm01824].
